summary: My take on experimenting with ENB settings.
descriptionHtml:
If you\'re looking for something fancy and out of the ordinary, well then this isn\'t really for you, but you\'re welcome to try it anyway. 
Seen a lot of ENB\'s already released on nexus, so I thought of giving it a shot as well to make something that suites my taste or at least come close to it and most likely haven\'t arrived to that conclusion (hard at deciding over certain things).

[center][IMG]http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb280/Shadow_SoD_/Skyrim%20Shots/banner1.png[/IMG][/center]

[font=comicsansms][size=6][b][i][color=orange]Installation:[/i][/b][/font][/size][/color]

[list]
[*]Download and extract the files within the archive to Skyrim\'s main folder, the place where you find TESV.exe (usually \"C:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\")
[*]Download ENB v0.119 from it\'s official site located [url=http://www.enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0119.htm]here[/url] and extract it anywhere and copy the \"d3d9.dll\" from the \"Wrapper\" folder to your Skyrim main folder
[*]Be sure to check if \"bFloatPointRenderTarget\" is set to 1 in SkyrimPrefs.ini, found in \"My Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\" folder.
[*]Enjoy!
[/list]

[b][i][color=orange]Note:[/i][/b][/color]
[list]
[*]The ENB was created while using \"Project Reality - Climates Of Tamriel\" by jjc71 Level 2 Nights and \"Realistic Lighting With Customization\" by Plutoman101. So depending on what you use the atmosphere may differ.
[*]Not an expert in customizing ENB\'s, so no hate if anything looks odd, I\'m still learning.[/list]

[font=comicsansms][b][i][color=orange]Credits:[/i][/b][/font][/color]
[list]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2971]Boris Vorontsov[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/5587]Masto[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/4142]HeliosDoubleSix[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17400]osmiumbin[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8005]--JawZ--[/url]
[/list]

[i](If I missed someone please let me know, since it\'s my first time, I\'m not really sure who I need to credit for making these things possible)[/i]
author: eSoDian
